definition: (oral) to write (esp. for a living)/to spell out laboriously on squared paper
to crawl/to climb/to get up or sit up
square/frame/rule/(legal) case/style/character/standard/pattern/(grammar) case/(classical) to obstruct/to hinder/(classical) to arrive/to come/(classical) to investigate/to study exhaustively

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Can have two whole days every week to crawl on the checkers without disturbance.
sentences.chinese: 一個禮拜可以有兩天時間在家踏踏實實地爬格子。

sentences.english: My father often writes. That is his job.
sentences.chinese: 我的爸爸經常“爬格子”，那是他的職業。

sentences.english: I can have two whole days every week to crawl on the checkers without disturbance.
sentences.chinese: 一個禮拜可以有兩天時間在家踏踏實實地爬格子。

definition: circular finger movement (in playing plucked instrument)/strumming
to read a score/to read music
(music) fingering/(TCM) manipulation of acupuncture needles/(keyboard) typing technique/(dance) hand movements/(painting) finger method
to notate music/to write a score

to indicate the phonetic value of a word using other words
